column5: Has anyone attended the All-Canada show in the past? Is it soley outfitters or are there booths with gear and such? I'm looking at going to the Minneapolis show 1-7 thru 1-9.
Has anyone attended the All-Canada show in the past? Is it soley outfitters or are there booths with gear and such? I'm looking at going to the Minneapolis show 1-7 thru 1-9.

HI. I HAVE BEEN TO THEONE AROUND CHICAGO and its just resorts and lodges and some speakers. Its a good place to just walk around and get a load of brochures and booklets from canadian resorts. then later you cn look through them.

HI. I HAVE BEEN TO THEONE AROUND CHICAGO and its just resorts and lodges and some speakers. Its a good place to just walk around and get a load of brochures and booklets from canadian resorts. then later you cn look through them.

Al-You can indeed pick up brochures and review them but I would definately get plenty of referrals from fishermen that have been to that particular lodge and the time of the year you would like to go. I would like to highly recommend Holinshead Lake Resort located 2 hrs. north of Thunder Bay. Feel free to e-mail me at [email protected]. I'd be happy to help you out.

[font color=green size=3][b]I gotta wonder why someone going to the Minneapolis show would want to drive clear over to Thunder Bay? Lac Suel or LOTW are prime areas with many, many outfitters, and they are straight North instead of East 200 miles and then North.

[font color=green size=3][b]I gotta wonder why someone going to the Minneapolis show would want to drive clear over to Thunder Bay? Lac Suel or LOTW are prime areas with many, many outfitters, and they are straight North instead of East 200 miles and then North.

If you are looking to talk to outfitters at the show be sure to ask them what makes them better than the other guy. We go on fly ins every year and use L&M Fly In, they have there own airplanes, great fishing, and everything goes smoothly.
